Class SmtpRequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • SmtpRequestHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

     class SmtpRequestHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
    The SmtpRequestHandler class is designed to handle an incoming SMTP request as specified by RFC 821 (www.ietf.org).
    Version:
    1.0a Date: 6/28/2008
    Author:
    Ken Molcsan Jr.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Constructor Detail

      • SmtpRequestHandler

        SmtpRequestHandler(java.net.Socket req,
                  java.lang.String dom,
                  java.lang.String dir)
        Purpose: The SmtpRequestHandler constructor initializes the thread for this handler. When called, it is passed the appropriate parameters to handle an incoming request object.
        Parameters:
        req - The socket which has been assigned to this incoming request must be passed in.
        dom - The acceptable destination domain name
        dir - The directory where accepted messages must be stored.
        See Also:
        nothing

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Purpose: The run() method is required to execute a process thread. For the SmtpRequestHandler, this will launch a command interpreter for a client session.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
        See Also:
        nothing

      • handleCommand

        private void handleCommand()
        Purpose: The handleCommand method is intended to identify the command type and send it to the appropriate command parse method.
        See Also:
        parseHelo, parseMail, parseRcpt, parseData, parseQuit, parseRset, parseNoop

      • heloDone

        private boolean heloDone()
        Purpose: The heloDone method will be used during command parsing to ensure that a HELO command has been received prior to executing message commands.
        Returns:
        boolean TRUE if a valid HELO command has been received, FALSE otherwise.
        See Also:
        parseHelo

      • parseHelo

        private void parseHelo(java.lang.String[] params)
        Purpose: This method is designed to parse a HELO command sent by the client. The command should consist of the HELO lexeme followed by an identifier of the sending machine or application.
        See Also:
        nothing

      • parseMail

        private void parseMail(java.lang.String[] params)
        Purpose: This method is designed to parse a MAIL command sent by the client. The command should consist of the MAIL lexeme followed by a FROM:
        parameter which contains the sender's address.
        See Also:
        nothing

      • parseRcpt

        private void parseRcpt(java.lang.String[] params)
        Purpose: This method is designed to parse a RCPT command sent by the client. The command should consist of the RCPT lexeme followed by a TO:
        parameter which contains the recipient address. NOTE: the recipient address must be a mailbox on this domain, otherwise it will be rejected.
        See Also:
        nothing

      • parseData

        private void parseData(java.lang.String[] params)
        Purpose: This method is designed to parse a DATA command sent by the client. The initial DATA command will trigger a response code of 314, indicating to the client that we are ready to listen for the message data until a character sequence of . is received.
        See Also:
        saveMsgData

      • saveMsgData

        private void saveMsgData()
        Purpose: The saveMsgData method is intended to save the sent message to the recipient(s) data-file(s)
        See Also:
        nothing

      • sendResponse

        private void sendResponse(int code,
                java.lang.String message)
        Purpose: The sendResponse method will format the response to the client based on the provided status code and message text.
        Parameters:
        code - Status code to indicate whether the operation was a success.
        message - Human readable message describing the status Preconditions: none
        See Also:
        nothing

      • resetMsg

        private void resetMsg()
        Purpose: Resetting the message whether by a RSET command, or by reaching the end of message transmission should be handled in the same way.
        See Also:
        nothing
